1122155565835333632.text:
Conversation starter for close friends: What was your inflection point?

Listen for the moments that woke them up like a splash of cold water. 

Who are they? What are they chasing? What do they worship?

The answers will surprise both of you.

1122898090317447168.text:
Q: As a member of an underrepresented group, do I HAVE to get involved in D&I activities at my company? 

A: Nope. By simply existing, you already have to perform so much emotional labor to survive your environment. And sometimes, that's all you can do. https://buff.ly/2M4rKoe pic.twitter.com/skRT1QKPvZ

1122634641423261696.text:
"Do they have more dogs on their webpage than black people" @bukkyadebayo on heuristics she looks for in a company to see if they truly value diversity and inclusion or if its superficial.
What are some heuristics you use to see if a company is a good fit? #recolor2019pic.twitter.com/EUOIU5mgs9

1122635627311185920.text: “If you are an underrepresented minority it is not your job to be the D&I person. If you want to, by all means speak about it, but it is the job of the leaders to prioritize D&I. Your job is not just D&I, your job is sometimes just to exist.” -@jenistyping

You're building for a great company period. Leads to better business outcomes, seeing opps."pic.twitter.com/nysoeSldcp

1122631096019996673.text: “The teams building the infrastructure of the internet were not diverse...maybe if we had women on the team earlier on we would have been able to catch these issues. With blockchain we are building the foundation right now and can choose to prioritize inclusion.” -@jenistyping

1122167471669010433.text:
My son gets sad over three things:
1. When he doesn’t feel understood
2. When he doesn’t feel accepted 
3. When he doesn’t get what he wants

So do many of my adult friends

Perhaps maturity is letting go of the addiction to being understood, being accepted & getting what we want

1123229949022724096.text: The managers we have vs the managers we wish we had https://twitter.com/fionaosaurusrex/status/1122901907427618816 …

1122523397081092097.text:
San Francisco is like a small college town where everyone is connected to each other by 3 degrees or fewer.

And it starts to become less fun when there are too many rich privileged kids running the scene, when the whole point of the experience was to learn and be scrappy.

1122954257290760192.text: Every time I get a new burst of followers, I feel like a nervous host welcoming people into my brain, “come in, so sorry it’s such a mess in here”

1085952817120960512.text:
Ask not, "how do I hire more women?" 

Instead ask, "How do I build a better environment for not only women, but people from all marginalized groups to thrive in?"

Invest in building a great workplace, and talented people of all backgrounds will be banging down your door

1122882433228132355.text:
On one hand, I get it—recruiting is hard, and even getting to the offer takes so much investment.

But that's no excuse to be unprofessional. Wish folks the best, and resolve to learn from the situation to do better next time. Otherwise, you're just making it harder for yourself.

Hiring Managers: when the candidate ends up declining your offer, accept the decision graciously. 

I keep hearing of poor behavior from startup CEOs on this—one actually called a friend to scream at her, that she chose wrong, "you'll regret this," etc. #StartupHiringTips
